channel.title: Rows and Columns on Aspose.Cells Product Family
channel.description: Recent content in Rows and Columns on Aspose.Cells Product Family

item.title: Adjusting Row Height and Column Width
item.description: When working with spreadsheets and adding data to rows or columns, you might need to change the height of rows or width of columns. Sometimes, applying formatting on rows or columns means that the current height or width needs to change to show the data. Normally, users adjust row heights and column widths in a WYSIWYG environment using Microsoft Excel. But, with Aspose.Cells developers can perform these operations at runtime.

item.title: AutoFit Rows and Columns
item.description: Microsoft Excel lets users auto size the width and height of cells according to its content. This feature is also available through Aspose.Cells so developers can auto size the dimensions of a cell at runtime. Contents Summary 1 Auto Fitting 1.1 AutoFit Row - Simple 1.2 AutoFit Row in a Range of Cells 1.3 AutoFit Column in a Range of Cells 1.4 AutoFit Rows for Merged Cells

item.title: Convert Text to Columns using Aspose.Cells
item.description: Contents Summary 1 Possible Usage Scenarios 2 Convert Text to Columns using Aspose.Cells 3 Sample Code | Possible Usage Scenarios You can convert your Text to Columns using Microsoft Excel. This feature is available from Data Tools under the *Data *tab. In order to split the contents of a column to multiple columns, the data should contain a specific delimiter such as a comma (or any other character) based on which Microsoft Excel splits the contents of a cell to multiple cells.

item.title: Copying Rows and Columns
item.description: Contents Summary 1 Introduction 2 Copying Rows and Columns with Microsoft Excel 3 Pasting Rows and Columns using Paste Options with Microsoft Excel 4 Using Aspose.Cells 4.1 Copying Rows 4.2 Copying Columns 4.3 Pasting Rows/Columns with Paste Options | Introduction Sometimes, you need to copy rows and columns in a worksheet without copying the entire worksheet. With Aspose.Cells, it is possible to copy rows and columns within or between workbooks.

item.title: Grouping and Ungrouping Rows and Columns
item.description: Contents Summary 1 Introduction 2 Group Management of Rows and Columns 2.1 Grouping Rows and Columns 2.1.1 Group Settings 2.2 Summary Rows to Below of Detail 2.3 Summary Columns to Right of Detail 3 Ungrouping Rows and Columns | Introduction In a Microsoft Excel file, you can create an outline for the data to let you show and hide levels of detail with a single mouse click.

item.title: Hiding and Showing Rows and Columns
item.description: Sometimes, it makes sense to hide certain rows or columns in a worksheet and display them later. Microsoft Excel provides this feature and so does Aspose.Cells. Contents Summary 1 Controlling the Visibility of Rows and Columns 1.1 Hiding Rows and Columns 1.2 Showing Rows and Columns 1.3 Hiding Multiple Rows and Columns || Controlling the Visibility of Rows and Columns Aspose.

item.title: Inserting and Deleting Rows and Columns
item.description: Contents Summary 1 Introduction 2 Managing Rows and Columns 2.1 Insert a Row 2.2 Inserting Multiple Rows 2.3 Insert a Row with Formatting 2.4 Deleting Multiple Rows 2.5 Insert a Column 2.6 Delete a Column | Introduction Whether creating a new worksheet from scratch or working on an existing worksheet, we may need to add extra rows or columns to accommodate more data.
